unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post about Yoga Practices:
normalised: What are some simple yoga practices that even a beginner can incorporate into their daily routine?

unnormalised: **What are some simple yoga practices that even a beginner can incorporate into their daily routine?**
normalised: Hey everyone! So you want to dip your toes into the amazing world of Yoga? Awesome! It's a fantastic way to boost your physical and mental wellbeing. Don't feel intimidated – it's not all headstands and advanced poses. There are plenty of super simple practices perfect for beginners.

unnormalised: Hey everyone! So you want to dip your toes into the amazing world of Yoga? Awesome! It's a fantastic way to boost your physical and mental wellbeing. Don't feel intimidated – it's not all headstands and advanced poses. There are plenty of super simple practices perfect for beginners.
normalised: First, Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutation) is a classic for a reason! Start with just three rounds in the morning. You can find tons of videos online breaking it down, even from instructors in Mysore, the Yoga hub.

unnormalised: First, Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutation) is a classic for a reason! Start with just 3 rounds in the morning. You can find tons of videos online breaking it down, even from instructors in Mysore, the Yoga hub.
normalised: Breathing exercises are key. Try Kapalabhati pranayama (skull shining breath) – just a few minutes in the morning can be really energizing. Remember to consult Doctor Sharma if you have any pre-existing health conditions.

unnormalised: Breathing exercises are key. Try Kapalabhati pranayama (skull shining breath) – just a few minutes in the morning can be really energizing. Remember to consult Dr. Sharma if you have any pre-existing health conditions.
normalised: For poses (asanas), try Tadasana (Mountain Pose) – sounds simple, but focusing on alignment makes a huge difference. Also, try Balasana (Child's Pose) – it's incredibly relaxing and a great way to de-stress after a long day at work, even if your office is only one hundred square feet.

unnormalised: For poses (asanas), try Tadasana (Mountain Pose) – sounds simple, but focusing on alignment makes a huge difference. Also, try Balasana (Child's Pose) – it's incredibly relaxing and a great way to de-stress after a long day at work, even if your office is only 100 sq ft.
normalised: End your practice with a short Savasana (Corpse Pose) – just lie down and focus on your breath for five to ten minutes. It's the best way to integrate the benefits.

unnormalised: End your practice with a short Savasana (Corpse Pose) – just lie down and focus on your breath for 5-10 minutes. It's the best way to integrate the benefits.
normalised: I started with just fifteen minutes a day, following classes from the Morarji Desai National Institute of Yoga. Now I do around forty five minutes. Remember, consistency is key! Even a little bit of yoga is better than none. Good luck on your Yoga journey and I hope you don't have to spend rupee five thousand on unnecessary yoga equipment!

unnormalised: I started with just 15 minutes a day, following classes from the Morarji Desai National Institute of Yoga. Now I do around 45 minutes. Remember, consistency is key! Even a little bit of yoga is better than none. Good luck on your Yoga journey and I hope you don't have to spend Rs. 5000 on unnecessary yoga equipment!
